content: interlocking rings potholder designed by makayla dean this potholder is my take on a potholder my great grandmother crocheted many decades ago her potholder was constructed with rings of double crochets around rubber mason jar seals which have since degraded past useability this potholder does not use rubber mason jar rings and instead uses a length of chains in a ring potholder is worked in row not in a spiral join each row with a slip_stitch finished size approximately 7 diameter materials 3 5 mm hook 40 yards of worsted weight yarn in two colors color a and color b 10 yards of worsted weight yarn in neutral color for inner ring and edging color c i used cotton yarn for my potholder so it would not melt when under a hot pot you can use wool cotton or any other fiber that will not melt acrylic polyester or nylon yarns are not recommended for this pattern unless the finished object is intended purely for decoration abbreviations chain = chain single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet slip_stitch = slip_stitch blo = back loop only all terms are us crochet components eight outer rings four of each color one inner ring outer rings make 4 with color a and 4 with color b 1 with color c chain 25 join to first chain with slip_stitch to form a ring being careful to not twist the chain fasten_off and weave yarn ends into chain 2 with color a make a slip knot and insert hook into loop pull slip knot snug and insert hook into center of chain 25 ring yarn over and pull up a loop then pull through loop on hook 55 single_crochet around the chain 25 ring you may need to pause and squash your stitches together on the ring if you run out of space join to first single_crochet with slip_stitch chain 1 55 3 1 blo half_double_crochet in every single_crochet around join to first half_double_crochet with slip_stitch chain 1 55 4 1 blo single_crochet in every half_double_crochet around join to first single_crochet with slip_stitch and fasten_off weave in all ends inner ring make 1 with color c 1 chain 61 61 2 half_double_crochet into second chain from hook 1 half_double_crochet in every chain after the last half_double_crochet chain 1 and turn work 3 1 blo single_crochet in every half_double_crochet after last single_crochet chain 1 and fasten_off leaving a long tail for sewing construction lay out the outer rings in a circle alternating colors and laying each ring on top of the last tuck the last ring under the first weave one end of the color c ribbon through the rings making sure to pass the ribbon over the left side of each ring and under the right side of each ring this part will take some massaging and maneuvering of the outer rings to get everything to lay flat and form a nice circle be sure to use pins to secure your rings while you work if
